entry.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
entry.summary: Gordon Ramsay visits Bonapartes in Silsden, West Yorkshire. The head chef Tim specialises in 'fine dining', but Ramsay discovers the true skills of the wannabe TV chef when he tastes his food and vomits in the gutter.

entry.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
entry.summary: The venue is The Glass House in Ambleside, where Ramsay finds owner Neil Farrell close to tears as another Saturday night turns into a nightmare.

entry.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
entry.summary: Gordon Ramsay meets Francesco Mattioli, the owner of The Walnut Tree Inn in South Wales, who needs his help.

entry.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
entry.summary: Ramsay visits Moore Place in Esher where joint owners Nick Whitehouse and Richard Hodgson are trying to create a profitable business.

entry.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
entry.summary: Multi Michelin-starred Gordon Ramsay travels to La Lanterna in Letchworth, Hertfordshire, an 'Italian' restaurant as authentic as its Hawaiian pizza that's losing Â£1,000 a week.

entry.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
entry.summary: This episode returns to 2005 where Gordon gets to grips with another Kitchen Nightmare. Can Gordon Ramsay turn around the fortunes of D-Place at Chelmsford in Essex, where the plastic food is dire and the manager loathes the chef?

entry.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
entry.summary: Gordon Ramsay turns his attention to Momma Cherri's Soul Food Shack, an intimate 40-seater a stone's throw from Brighton's sea front.

entry.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
entry.summary: The venue for this programme is La Riviera, a fine dining restaurant in Inverness. It boasts a top chef and wonderful staff, but the locals aren't biting and the restaurant is empty.

entry.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
entry.summary: At the family-run Oscars in Nantwich, the menu's a mess, the punter's aren't returning and the chef has problems. Cue Gordon Ramsay.

entry.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
entry.summary: The multi-Michelin-starred chef visits Sandgate in Kent, where husband-and-wife team Lois and Peter Hamilton-Slade own and run a small English seaside hotel.

entry.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
entry.summary: Gordon Ramsay gets stuck into the kitchens of Clubway 4; which is in trouble with a bizarre menu and demoralised staff.

entry.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
entry.summary: Gordon heads for Spain, where Laurence's up-market restaurant amid the Costa del Sol's caffs is, simply, a shambles.

entry.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
entry.summary: Gordon Ramsay takes on a pub for the first time; the Fenwick Arms, Lancashire. Can he persuade owner Brian to ditch his complex menu and cloying sauces for great, simple food?

entry.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
entry.summary: Gordon Ramsay tackles the fading Rococo restaurant in King's Lynn, run by Nick, an ex-Michelin-starred chef who's resting on his laurels with an overpriced menu trapped in the 90s.

entry.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
entry.summary: Gordon grapples with girl power when he takes on Morgan's, an intimate family-run restaurant in the heart of WAG territory near Liverpool.

entry.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
entry.summary: Gordon returns to La Riviera - now renamed Abstract - a fine dining restaurant in Inverness, as they plan to expand. Top French chef Loic Lefebvre is still there and has been promoted.

entry.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
entry.summary: Gordon returns to Momma Cherri's Soul Food Shack in Brighton to see how its owner Charita Jones is coping with a bustling business along with plans to expand.

entry.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
entry.summary: Ruby Tates in Brighton is owned and run by ex-actor and failed Hollywood wannabe Allan Love. It's an oyster bar and seafood restaurant but Allan's never tasted the food because he hates fish. Can Gordon help?

entry.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
entry.summary: Gordon takes on The Priory, a 100-seater carvery in Haywards Heath, Sussex. It's owned by ex-IT consultant Scott and located in a beautiful former convent, but is in desperate need of help.

entry.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
entry.summary: The venue for this programme is The Curry Lounge in Nottingham, the city with more restaurants per square mile than any other in Britain. Enter Gordon, relishing the prospect of tackling an Indian restaurant for the first time.

entry.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
entry.summary: Piccolo Teatro is a bijou vegetarian restaurant in Paris run by feisty Scot Rachel and her friend Stephanie, who are in need of a miracle to turn things around.

entry.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
entry.summary: Gordon Ramsay is back in Spain to see how Laurence is faring at La Parra de Burriana, an ex-pat restaurant in Nerja on the Costa del Sol.

entry.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
entry.summary: Gordon Ramsay is back to see how Brian and Elaine are faring at the Fenwick Arms in rural Lancashire.

entry.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
entry.summary: The venue for the final programme is The Granary in rural Hampshire, which at 200 covers, is the biggest challenge Gordon's ever taken on.

entry.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
entry.summary: Gordon visits the Fish & Anchor, a restaurant and bar near Lampeter in rural West Wales, owned and run by ex-boxer Mike and his wife Caron.

entry.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
entry.summary: Gordon revisits the Glass House Restaurant in Ambleside where some unexpected departures have taken place. So who is in charge of the kitchen now and how are they faring?

entry.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
entry.summary: Ramsay revisits the Walnut Tree Inn, set in beautiful Welsh countryside. Last time it was struggling to survive and Gordon gave the owner, Francesco, his best advice, but did he take it?

entry.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
entry.summary: Gordon revisits Moore Place to see if his fast-track guide to restaurant success helped Nick and Richard transform their failing ex-Berni Inn.

entry.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
entry.summary: Gordon revisits Bonapartes in Silsden to see if his potent recipe of passion, perfectionism and inspirational leadership continues.
entry.dc:relation.Guidance: Very strong language from the start and throughout
